cluster_classes.class_description: Systems and practices of unfair treatment targeted and opposed by the U.S. civil rights movement.

members.entity_description: System of separating people based on race, targeted by the U.S. civil rights movement.
Unfair treatment of people, particularly on racial grounds, opposed by the civil rights movement.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts related to police brutality and organized social movements formed in response to it, particularly around systemic racism and law enforcement violence.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The Black Lives Matter movement, which emerged in response to police brutality and systemic racism in the United States

members.entity_description: A social and political movement responding to police brutality and systemic racism in the United States.
The use of excessive or unwarranted force by law enforcement officers against civilians.

args.new_name: Racial Segregation and Discrimination (U.S. Civil Rights Era)
args.new_description: Systems and practices of racial segregation and discrimination in the United States that were central targets of the mid-20th century civil rights movement.
args.new_class_group: Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements
args.justification: Entities cover foundational racial injustices (segregation, discrimination) opposed by the U.S. civil rights movement; updating the label/description and assigning a shared Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements group aligns it with the related police brutality class while keeping its historical focus distinct.

args.new_name: Police Brutality and Contemporary Racial Justice Movements
args.new_description: Police brutality and the contemporary social and political movements, such as Black Lives Matter, that respond to systemic racism and law enforcement violence.
args.new_class_group: Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements
args.justification: Entities center on police brutality and the Black Lives Matter movement; updating the label/description clarifies its contemporary scope and assigning the same Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements group connects it appropriately to the related civil-rights-era injustices class while preserving their conceptual distinction.

executed_decisions.new_name: Racial Segregation and Discrimination (U.S. Civil Rights Era)
executed_decisions.new_description: Systems and practices of racial segregation and discrimination in the United States that were central targets of the mid-20th century civil rights movement.
executed_decisions.new_class_group: Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements

executed_decisions.new_name: Police Brutality and Contemporary Racial Justice Movements
executed_decisions.new_description: Police brutality and the contemporary social and political movements, such as Black Lives Matter, that respond to systemic racism and law enforcement violence.
executed_decisions.new_class_group: Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements
executed_decisions.justification: Entities center on police brutality and the Black Lives Matter movement; updating the label/description clarifies its contemporary scope and assigning the same Civil Rights and Racial Justice Movements group connects it appropriately to the related civil-rights-era injustices class while preserving their conceptual distinction.
